The following is a proposed generalization of the HyperNEAT concept 
from i=
ts present implementation. The objectives are two-fold. First, 
to expand t=
he scope of problems in which the HyperNEAT approach may 
be applied. Secon=
d, to enable evolved partition of the design space, 
so as to enable applic=
ation of the HyperNEAT approach to problems 
which contain highly discontin=
uous and divergent natures in different 
portions of the design space. It i=
s intended to provide a starting 
point for further thought and interchange=
 of ideas, with the focus on 
achieving the stated objectives by whatever m=
eans or changes which 
may emerge.

1 - Preliminary Definitions: Given an a=
rbitrary point "P" in design 
space, comprised of the following:
(a) proble=
m specific inputs (PSIs);
(b) auxiliary additional parameters associated w/=
 PSIs (i.e. includes 
geometry);
(c) problem specific outputs (PSOs);
(d) a=
uxiliary additional parameters associated w/ PSOs (i.e. includes 
geometry)=
;
(e) Substrate Inputs: comprised of PSIs, "a" above;
(f) Substrate Outputs=
: comprised of PSOs, "c" above;
(g) CPPN Inputs: comprised of auxiliary add=
itional parameters 
associated w/ PSIs & PSOs, "b" & "d" above;
(h) CPPN Ou=
tput: weight between current pair of substrate nodes;
(i) An "experience_po=
int" is defined as a struct containing items "a" 
through "d" above;
(j) Th=
e "Experience" is defined as a vector of experience_points;

2 - Current Hy=
perNEAT Implementation:
(a) CPPN Inputs comprised of (1-b) and (1-d) are ea=
ch constant in 
number and meaning as you loop over the links in the substr=
ate 
network (i.e. 3D CPPN "From" Input: quan. =3D 3, meaning =3D X, Y & Z =

coordinates)

3 - Proposed Generalization For CPPN Input:
(a) the quantity=
 and meaning of auxiliary additional parameters 
associated w/ PSIs (1-b) c=
an vary over the substrate network (i.e. 
dimensionality of substrate input=
s, hidden and output nodes);
(b) the quantity and meaning of auxiliary addi=
tional parameters 
associated w/ PSOs (1-d) can vary over the substrate net=
work (i.e. 
dimensionality of substrate inputs, hidden and output nodes);
(=
c) CPPN Input "From": the quantity and meanings are defined to be 
the supe=
rset of possible auxiliary additional parameters associated 
w/ PSIs and PS=
Os (i.e. 5D CPPN "From" Input: quan. =3D 5, meaning =3D X, 
Y, Z, apples & =
oranges);
(d) CPPN Input "To": the quantity and meanings are defined to be =
the 
superset of possible auxiliary additional parameters associated w/ 
PS=
Is and PSOs (i.e. 5D CPPN "To" Input: quan. =3D 5, meaning =3D X, Y, Z, 
ap=
ples & oranges);
(e) the meaning of any given CPPN Input node, for both "Fr=
om" 
or "To", remains constant (i.e. only apples are presented on the 
appl=
es input node);
(f) the quantity of zero is presented on any CPPN Input nod=
e whose 
dimensionality, or meaning, is not present/applicable for the curr=
ent 
CPPN Input "From" or "To";

4 - Proposed Generalization For Evolved Pa=
rtition of Design Space:
(a) Evaluation of speciation of CPPN population al=
ong design space 
partition lines, as defined by allocation of experience_p=
oints 
addressed by a specific species (i.e. species "0" by default 
addres=
ses all experience_points, species "1" through "n" addresses 
only those ex=
perience_points which yield a higher absolute fitness 
than species "0";
(b=
) species fitness computed based upon percentage of 
experience_points yiel=
ding a highest absolute fitness among all 
species (i.e. if species "1" gav=
e best fitness for 25 percent of the 
experience_points, then the species f=
itness would be the summation of 
fitness for those specific experience_poi=
nts);
(c) objective to maximize overall fitness of "Experience" as 
summati=
on of best individual from each species over those 
experience_points for w=
hich they were evolved and maintained the best 
fitness (i.e. all experienc=
e_points addressed only once);
